title: July 4th Celebrations
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands in front of a crowd outside the Harry S. Truman Library before speaking at the Fourth of July celebration.  All others unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman congratulates two Marine recipients of the Congressional Medal of Honor.  They are Major Reginald R. Myers (left), Boise, Idaho; and Major Carl L. Sitter (right), Pueblo, Colorado. They were honored for heroism in Korea. Navy Secretary Dan Kimball is standing in the background behind Major Meyers.  The location for the event is the Rose Garden at the White House.  Other officials and family members are standing behind the president and the recipients.

title: Mrs. Truman and Margaret in Miami
Scopenote: Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (left) and Margaret Truman arrive in Miami, Florida, en route to Key West, where they will spend the Easter holiday at the Little White House with President Truman.  Donor: New York Herald Tribune

title: Mrs. Truman Attempting to Christen an Airplane
Scopenote: Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman attempting to break a bottle of champagne against the nose of a Navy hospital evacuation plane in order to christen it.  A Navy officer is reaching up with a tool to bang the bottle and help her break it, after repeated vain attempts by Mrs. Truman. Standing behind Mrs. Truman is George Elsey.

title: Harry, Bess, and Margaret Truman
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman, Mrs. Bess Truman, and Margaret Truman, shown in their Independence home, reading over scores of congratulatory telegrams received when late election returns indicated his victory over Democratic rivals, Governor Lloyd Stark and Maurice Williams, in the Missouri Primary Senatorial race.  From the New York Herald Tribune.

title: Truman driving convertible
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman smiles broadly as he takes the wheel of his new convertible club coupe as he starts on a drive in the Charlottesville, Virginia area during a holiday weekend vacation.  With him are (from left to right, front seat) Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder; Stanley Woodward, State Department Protocol chief and President Truman's host; President Truman; (back seat, left to right) Rear Admiral James H. Foskett, Naval Aide; and Major General Harry H. Vaughan, military Aide.  From: New York Herald Tribune

title: Police and Spectators Around Entrance to Blair House After Assassination Attempt
Scopenote: Police and spectators crowd around the entrance to Blair House, residence of President Harry S. Truman.  A wounded man lies on the steps following a furious gun battle in front of the house, during an attempted assassination of President Truman.  Donor:  New York Herald Tribune.

title: Body of Unsuccessful Assassin Torresola on Lawn at Blair House
Scopenote: One of the men who tried to force his way into Blair House in an attempt to assassinate President Harry S. Truman, Griselio Torresola, is shown on the ground with his German Luger pistol at his feet. He was killed in the attempt. Donor: New York Herald Tribune.

title: Unsuccessful Assassin Oscar Collazo Lies Injured on Ground at Blair House
Scopenote: One of the two armed men who tried to force their way into Blair House, President Harry S. Truman's residence, lies sprawled at the entrance after being felled by White House Guards.  He is Oscar Collazo.  The other gunman also was felled and three guards wounded (one died) in the exchange of gunfire.    Donor:  New York Herald Tribune.

title: Exterior of Blair House Showing the Steps of the Assassination Attempt on President Truman
Scopenote: Entrance to Blair House where Oscar Collazo fell wounded at the foot of the steps (1); (2) shrubbery where Griselio Torresola was killed; (3) and (4) sentry boxes from which fire was exchanged with attackers; (5) spot where a White House policeman fell fatally wounded.  This photos shows the steps of the attempted assassination of President Harry S. Truman.  Donor:  New York Herald Tribune.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Congressional Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with and greets recipients of the Congressional Medal of Honor. From left to right: Mike Colalillo; Robert H. Dunlap; Richard M. McCool; President Truman; Vernon McGarity; Frank Burke; Vito R. Bertoldo. The original photo has been retouched.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Four Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman joins hands with two soldiers and two sailors who served during World War II and have just received the Congressional Medal of Honor. From left to right: Sergeant John R. McKinney, Woodcliff, Georgia; First Lieutenant Daniel W. Lee, Alma, Georgia; President Truman; Lieutenant Donald A. Gary, Oakland, California; and Commander Joseph T. O'Callahan. The ceremony took place in the Oval Office at the White House. The original photo has been retouched.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards Medal of Honor to Recipient
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, center, is shown awarding the Congressional Medal of Honor to one of the 28 recipients (left) who received the award in the East Room of the White House in front of family and dignitaries.  The man standing behind the desk is Major General Harry Vaughan. The dignitaries seated in the front row on the right are (from right to left): Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal; Secretary of War Henry Stimson; unidentified man; General George C. Marshall; Fleet Admiral William Leahy; and General Henry "Hap" Arnold. A group of photographers are visible behind the President.  All others are unidentified. The original print is heavily retouched.

title: President Truman with Former President Hoover
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and former President Herbert Hoover discussing the problem of feeding the liberated peoples of Europe.  This photo is similar to 66-2590.

title: Truman gavels in the Senate
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman (standing) raises the gavel to call the Senate into session for the first time since taking over his new office. Seated around the rostrum are Wall Doxey, Sergeant at Arms; Edward J. Hickey, Journal clerk; Charles L. Watkins, Parliamentarian; John C. Crockett, Chief Clerk and reading clerk; and Emery Frazier, Legislative Clerk.

title: President and Mrs. Truman in Their Box at the Inaugural Ball
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and First Lady Bess Truman are seated in their box at the inaugural ball. Seated to the right of Mrs. Truman is her niece, Marian Wallace, and her nephew, David Wallace.  Donor:  New York Herald Tribune.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and Bess W. Truman in Venice, Italy
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman relax in a gondola lent to them by the Mayor Venice, Italy May 31st on the last day of their Italian vacation.  Donor: New York Herald Tribune

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands with Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman congratulates three soldiers who fought in the Korean War after he presented them with the Congressional Medal of Honor in a ceremony at the White House. From left to right:  Marine Master Sergeant Harold E. Wilson, Birmingham, Alabama; President Truman; Army Lieutenant Lloyd L. Burke, Stuttgart, Arkansas; and Army Corporal Rodolfo P. Hernandez, Fowler, California. Various unidentified family members present at the ceremony stand directly behind them. Those identified on the back top row include, from left to right:  General Omar N. Bradley, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, far left; Arkansas Representative William F. Norrell, 5th from the left; Frank Pace, Secretary of the Army, 6th from the left; Alabama Senator Lister Hill, 3rd from the right; Dan A. Kimball, Secretary of the Navy, 2nd from the right; and Robert A. Lovett, Secretary of Defense, far right. All others are unidentified.

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Medal of Honor to Raymond G. Davis
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left, standing behind podium with U.S. Seal) presents the Congressional Medal of Honor to Marine Lieutenant Colonel Raymond G. Davis, Arlington, Virginia. The ceremony was held at the White House.  Colonel Davis was one of three U.S. Marines who received the award at the ceremony for their heroism in helping their division break out to sea in the Chosin Reservoir fighting in Korea in 1950.  Also in view are Mrs. Davis holding daughter Willa, age two, and Gilbert, age nine, partially hidden, and six year old Miles Davis on the right. The original print is retouched.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: Three U.S. Marines whose heroism helped their division break out to sea in the desperate Chosin Reservoir fighting in Korea two years previous, are congratulated by President Harry S. Truman after he presented each the Congressional Medal of Honor in the Rose Garden at the White House. Sharing a handshake left to right: Private First Class Hector A. Cafferata, Montville, New Jersey; President Truman; Technical Sergeant Robert S. Kennemore, Oakland, California; and Lieutenant Colonel Raymond G. Davis, Arlington, Virginia. The photograph shows evidence of being touched up by the newspaper.

title: President Truman steering a ship
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at the wheel of the training ship Eagle during a visit to the U. S. Coast Guard Academy at New London, Connecticut, September 20th.   Donor: New York Herald Tribune

title: Truman receiving life membership
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) receiving a life membership in the Legion of Honor of the Ararat Temple.  With him is Joseph H.  Gunther (left), Commander of the Legion of Honor of the Ararat Temple, and Frank Land (center), Imperial Second Ceremonial Master of the Shrine and founder of the Order of DeMolay.   Donor: New York Herald Tribune

title: President Truman's berth on his campaign train, the Ferdinand Magellan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's berth in his special railroad car, in which he made the trip from Washington, D. C. to Detroit for a Labor Day speech.  A telephone on the dresser (right) provides him with direct communication with the White House when necessary.  The car carried him to most parts of the United States in the 1948 election campaign.  Donor: New York Herald Tribune

title: Dining compartment aboard President Truman's train, the Ferdinand Magellan
Scopenote: The dining compartment of President Harry S. Truman's special railroad car, in which he made the trip from Washington, D. C. to Detroit for a Labor Day speech.  The car carried him to most parts of the United States in the 1948 Presidential election campaign.  Donor: New York Herald Tribune

title: Lounge Compartment of President Truman's Train
Scopenote: The lounge compartment of President Harry S. Truman's special railroad car, in which he made the trip from Washington, D.C. to Detroit, Michigan for a Labor Day speech. Note the Presidential Seal on the wall (right). The car carried him to most parts of the United States in the 1948 election campaign. Donor: New York Herald Tribune

title: President Truman Smokes Peace Pipe with Chief First To Fly
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with Native Americans on the rear platform of his train while on a Whistlestop tour in support of Adlai Stevenson's presidential campaign. He smokes a peace pipe with Assiniboine Chief First to Fly (shown at right with horned ceremonial head gear) in Glasgow, Montana. Two years earlier, President Truman had been made "Chief Bear Soldier" by the Assiniboine (Hohe Nakota) people. The other two Native Americans are unidentified. Donor: New York Herald Tribune.

title: Truman with Margaret outside Senate office
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman points out the new sign over his door in the Senate office building to his daughter, Margaret Truman.  From: New York Herald Tribune

title: President Truman Receives Christmas Turkey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (second from right) helps subdue a Christmas turkey which almost got away from him during a presentation ceremony at the White House. Also present is Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson. Others are unidentified.

title: President Truman and Chaim Weizmann with Torah
Scopenote: Dr. Chaim Weizmann, President of Israel, presents a Torah of Holy Scroll to President Harry S. Truman (left) during a visit to the White House.  See also 59-848.  Donor:  New York Herald Tribune.

title: Truman surprised by a turkey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, inspecting two turkeys given to him as gifts by the Poultry and Egg National Board and the National Turkey Federation, was surprised when one grabbed his arm.  Donor: New York Herald Tribune.

title: President Truman Meets with Ute Tribe Members
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with members of the Utah tribes. The Native Americans are (l to r): Reginald Curry of the Uncompahgre Ute Tribe, Lawrence Appah of the White River Ute Tribe, and Julius Murray of the Uintah Ute Tribe, all of Fort Duchesne, Utah. The president holds in his hand a peace pipe said to have been smoked for 15 years by Sitting Bull. The Indian tribe members were visiting the president in his office to witness a bill signing creating an Indian Claims Commission. (As enacted, H.R. 4497 is Public Law 726, 79th Congress.) Donor: New York Herald Tribune.

title: President Harry S. Truman Awards Congressional Medal of Honor
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) congratulates Master Sergeant Hubert L. Lee (left) of Leland, Mississippi, and Sergeant First Class Joseph C. Rodriguez (right) of San Bernardino, California, after presenting Medals of Honor to them for valor on Korean battlefields. Donor: New York Herald Tribune

title: Truman salutes 4th of July Parade from his home in Independence
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman salutes the parade marshal of the 4th of July parade from the steps of his home on Delaware Street in Independence, Missouri.

title: Cartoon "This Side Up" by Al Hirschfeld
Scopenote: Cartoon "This Side Up" by Al Hirschfeld, illustrating "Two Views of Harry Truman" in Pageant Magazine, 3-51.  One side depicts Harry S. Truman as an angel, the other side as a devil.   From:  Harry S. Truman Library museum collection.

title: Corner of 12th and Baltimore
Scopenote: Photo of Baltimore Street from the corner of 12th Street in Kansas City, Missouri. Harry S. Truman owned a haberdashery store with Eddie Jacobson that was located at 104 Baltimore from 1919-1922. The store was formerly located between the Liggett Drugstore on the corner, and the entrance to the Hotel Glennon.

title: Portrait of Harry Easley
Scopenote: Portrait of Harry Easley used in his oral history interview.  Donor: Mr. Easley.

title: Truman With Students in His Office
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (in light suit, center) with a group of unidentified students from the Greater Kansas City Tennis Patrons, standing around the globe in Mr. Truman's office at the Truman Library. The man on the far left is Richard Berkley (later Mayor of Kansas City). Man on the far right is George Michalson (later a lawyer for Middle West Motor Freight Bureau). All others are unidentified.

title: Harry S. Truman with students (Raytown Debate Team) in his office at Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (sixth from left) and the Raytown Debate Team (students) look at the globe in his office at the Harry S. Truman Library.  Donor:  Kansas City Star.

title: Truman and Acheson
Scopenote: Former Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left) seated, talking with former President Harry S. Truman (right), in Mr. Truman's office at the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Truman with Dean Acheson
Scopenote: Former Secretary of State Dean Acheson (left) seated, talking with former President Harry S. Truman (right), in Mr. Truman's office at the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Official color White House portrait of Bess Truman
Scopenote: Official White House portrait of Bess Truman, painted by Greta Kempton.  Same as 71-2577.  Donor:  James Ketchum, curator, White House

title: Bob Hope with Former President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman
Scopenote: Entertainer Bob Hope (second from left) visits with Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (second from right) and former President Harry S. Truman (right) at the Truman home. Also present is Joyce C. Hall (left).

title: Bob Hope with Former President Harry S. Truman and Bess Truman
Scopenote: Entertainer Bob Hope (left) visits with Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (center) and former President Harry S. Truman (right) at the Truman home.
